head.supplied: Colombo ¶ 26/7/89. ¶ ¶ […] ¶ ¶ Re the specific name of "White Ash" I may mention that I recieved ¶ Baron von Mullers return today and give it verbatum: " ¶ Near ¶ E. piperita perhaps a hybrid". […...

div.p: From Wilhelm Bäuerlen to Joseph Maiden
MRS 203, Inwards correspondence — special bundles, 1886-1921 Item 1, 89/256, Archives of the Powerhouse Museum, Sydney.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
Re the specific name of "White Ash" I may mention that I recieved
sic.
Baron von Mullers return today and give it verbatum: " Near E. piperita perhaps a hybrid". […]

Soon I noticed a number of young suckers with the young state leaves quite different from those of the White Ash, and I also noticed that the tree was very rich in kino. It was getting late and I had 12 miles to walk yet, therefore for the time [being] I merely collected on the ground a few fruiting specimens with their leaves on and specimens of young state leaves. Those I sent to Baron von Muller with the White Ash specimens, who determined them as E. piperita var . The fruit is something like E. piperita yet somewhat different in shape and much smaller, while the stem in both its barks is quite different. The leaves are very narrow and have the oil dots more numerous than those of any othr species I have seen. The head of the tree is finer in appearance than that even of the "White Ash". […]
The strange "Box" from this locality (Colombo) the Baron has determined as E. viminalis var . This must be a mistake. […]

My experience lately amongst the Eucalypts convinces me more and more every day that much remains to be done to get clear about them, and in order to help me on with my observations I have written to the Government Printer of Melbourne to send me Baron von Mullers "Eucalyptographia", as the enclosed will show, but by the Gov. Pr. reply I can not see how I can get it […]
Not relevant.
